00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 #include <stdlib.h>
00015 #include <pthread.h>
00016 #include <ptask.h>
00017 #include <obix_client.h>

00021 #define CONNECTION_ID 0
00022 
00023 const char* DEVICE_DATA =
00024     "<obj name=\"ExampleTimer\" displayName=\"Example Timer\" href=\"%s\">\r\n"
00025     "  <reltime name=\"time\" displayName=\"Elapsed Time\" href=\"%stime\" val=\"PT0S\" writable=\"true\"/>\r\n"
00026     "  <bool name=\"reset\" displayName=\"Reset Timer\" href=\"%sreset\" val=\"false\" writable=\"true\"/>\r\n"
00027     "</obj>";
00028 
00030 unsigned long _time;
00032 char _time_str[32];
00037 pthread_mutex_t _time_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00039 Task_Thread* taskThread;
00040 
00050 int resetListener(int connectionId,
00051                   int deviceId,
00052                   int listenerId,
00053                   const char* newValue)
00054 {
00055     if (strcmp(newValue, "false") == 0)
00056     {
00057         // ignore this update
00058         return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00059     }
00060 
00061     // new value is true, thus we need to reset timer
00062     pthread_mutex_lock(&_time_mutex);
00063     _time = 0;
00064     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_time_mutex);
00065     printf("Timer is set to 0.\n");
00066 
00067     // reset also "reset" field of the timer at the oBIX server
00068     int error = obix_writeValue(connectionId, deviceId, "reset", "false", OBIX_T_BOOL);
00069     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00070     {
00071         printf("Unable to set \"reset\" field at the oBIX server "
00072                "to \"false\".\n");
00073         return -1;
00074     }
00075 
00076     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00077 }
00078 
00083 void generateTimeString()
00084 {
00085     unsigned long hours = _time / 3600;
00086     int minutes = (_time % 3600) / 60;
00087     int seconds = _time % 60;
00088 
00089     int length = sprintf(_time_str, "PT");
00090     if (hours != 0)
00091     {
00092         length += sprintf(_time_str + length, "%luH", hours);
00093     }
00094     if (minutes != 0)
00095     {
00096         length += sprintf(_time_str + length, "%dM", minutes);
00097     }
00098 
00099     sprintf(_time_str + length, "%dS", seconds);
00100 }
00101 
00113 void timerTask(void* arg)
00114 {
00115     // lock mutex in order to prevent other threads
00116     // from accessing _time variable while we update it
00117     pthread_mutex_lock(&_time_mutex);
00118     _time++;
00119     generateTimeString();
00120     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_time_mutex);
00121 
00122     // send updated time to the server
00123     int deviceId = *((int*) arg);
00124     int error = obix_writeValue(CONNECTION_ID, deviceId, "time", _time_str, OBIX_T_RELTIME);
00125     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00126     {
00127         printf("Unable to update elapsed time at the server.\n");
00128     }
00129 }
00130 
00131 char* getDeviceData(char* deviceUri)
00132 {
00133     // length of data template +
00134     // 3 * (length of device URI - length of '%s' which is substituted) +
00135         // 1 for end character
00136     char* data = (char*) malloc(strlen(DEVICE_DATA)
00137                                 + (strlen(deviceUri) - 2)*3 + 1);
00138     sprintf(data, DEVICE_DATA, deviceUri, deviceUri, deviceUri);
00139     return data;
00140 }
00141 
00149 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00150 {
00151     if (argc != 3)
00152     {
00153         printf("Usage: example_clock <config_file> <device_uri>\n"
00154                " where <config_file> - Address of the configuration file;\n"
00155                "       <device_uri>  - URI at which device will be "
00156                "registered.\n");
00157         return -1;
00158     }
00159 
00160     // load connection settings from file
00161     int error = obix_loadConfigFile(argv[1]);
00162     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00163     {
00164         printf("Unable to load configuration file.\n");
00165         return error;
00166     }
00167 
00168     // open connection to the server
00169     error = obix_openConnection(CONNECTION_ID);
00170     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00171     {
00172         printf("Unable to establish connection with oBIX server.\n");
00173         return error;
00174     }
00175 
00176     // register timer device at the server
00177     char* deviceData = getDeviceData(argv[2]);
00178     int deviceId = obix_registerDevice(CONNECTION_ID, deviceData);
00179     free(deviceData);
00180     if (deviceId < 0)
00181     {
00182         printf("Unable to register device at oBIX server.\n");
00183         return deviceId;
00184     }
00185 
00186     // register listener of the "reset" field
00187     // it will be invoked every time when someone changes
00188     // "reset" field at the server
00189     int listenerId = obix_registerListener(CONNECTION_ID,
00190                                            deviceId,
00191                                            "reset",
00192                                            &resetListener);
00193     if (listenerId < 0)
00194     {
00195         printf("Unable to register update listener.\n");
00196         return listenerId;
00197     }
00198 
00199     // Initialize separate thread for timer
00200     taskThread = ptask_init();
00201     if (taskThread == NULL)
00202     {
00203         printf("Unable to start separate thread for timer.\n");
00204         return -1;
00205     }
00206     // start updating time once in a second
00207     int timerTaskId = ptask_schedule(taskThread, &timerTask, &deviceId,
00208                                      1000, EXECUTE_INDEFINITE);
00209 
00210     printf("Example timer is successfully registered at the server\n\n"
00211            "Press Enter to stop timer and exit...\n");
00212     // wait for user input
00213     getchar();
00214 
00215     // shutdown gracefully
00216 
00217     // stop timer task
00218     if (ptask_cancel(taskThread, timerTaskId))
00219     {
00220         printf("Unable to stop timer task.\n");
00221         return -1;
00222     }
00223     ptask_dispose(taskThread);
00224 
00225     // release all resources allocated by oBIX client library.
00226     // No need to close connection or unregister listener explicitly - it is
00227     // done automatically.
00228     obix_dispose();
00229 
00230     return 0;
00231 }
